record.description: Astronomer Dr. Carl Keenan Seyfert looks through the McDonald telescope finder. He holds a portable box, which controls the movements of the telescope and dome. Both the observatory, in the Davis Mountains of Western Texas, and its 82-inch reflecting telescope, the second largest in the world, were designed and built by the Warner and Swasey Company of Cleveland, Ohio for the University of Texas which will operate the facility with the University of Chicago. The observatory will be dedicated May 5, 1939.
